Making great food is my passion, my purpose, and my favorite thing to share with others.", "sameAs": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/about/", "https://www.facebook.com/budgetbytes1", "https://x.com/Budget_Bytes"], "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/author/beth/"}, {"@type": "Recipe", "name": "The Best Broccoli Cheddar Soup", "author": {"@id": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/#/schema/person/de533a4dad507aefcf8ea04e131701f9"}, "description": "This easy Broccoli Cheddar Soup recipe is chock full of colorful, chunky vegetables in a rich and cheesy broth for a totally meal-worthy soup. Step-by-step videos can be seen below the recipe card.", "datePublished": "2025-10-03T08:30:00+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Broccoli-Cheddar-Soup-one-bowl.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Broccoli-Cheddar-Soup-one-bowl-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Broccoli-Cheddar-Soup-one-bowl-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Broccoli-Cheddar-Soup-one-bowl-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Easy Broccoli Cheddar Soup", "description": "This super easy Broccoli Cheddar Soup is chock full of colorful, chunky vegetables in a rich and cheesy broth for a totally meal-worthy soup. FULL RECIPE BELOW. \ud83d\udc47\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/easy-broccoli-cheddar-soup/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n1 yellow onion ($0.52)\n1 lb. broccoli ($1.49)\n2 carrots ($0.23)\n4 Tbsp butter ($0.52)\n4 Tbsp all-purpose flour ($0.04)\n2 cups chicken broth ($0.24)\n2 cups whole milk ($0.75)\n1/2 tsp smoked paprika ($0.05)\n1/4 tsp garlic powder ($0.02)\n1/4 tsp freshly cracked black pepper ($0.02)\n1/8 tsp cayenne pepper ($0.02)\n6 oz. sharp cheddar, shredded ($1.27)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Dice the onion. Chop the broccoli into very small pieces. Peel and slice the carrots.\n2. Add the butter and onion to a large soup pot and saut\u00e9 over medium until the onions are soft and translucent. Add the flour and continue to saut\u00e9 for about 2 minutes more, or until the flour is coating the bottom of the pot and is a light golden brown color.\n3. Add the chicken broth and whisk to dissolve all the flour off the bottom of the pot. Turn the heat up to medium-high and, while stirring often, allow the broth to come up to a simmer. When it reaches a simmer it will thicken to a gravy consistency.\n4. Turn the heat back down to medium and whisk in the milk, smoked paprika, garlic powder, black pepper, and cayenne pepper. Allow the broth to come back up to a simmer.\n5. Add the chopped broccoli and carrots, allow the broth to come back up to a simmer, and continue to simmer the vegetables, stirring often, for 15 minutes, or until the carrots are tender.\n6. Finally, turn the heat down to medium-low and stir the shredded cheese into the soup, one handful at a time, until it is fully melted. Taste the soup and add salt if needed (this will depend on the salt content of your broth-I did not add any).\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/ \n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Intro\n0:07 Saut\u00e9 onions in butter\n0:13 Add flour and Saut\u00e9\n0:17 Add Chicken broth and simmer\n0:24 Add spices and milk\n0:34 Add Broccoli and carrots\n0:42 Melt in cheddar\n0:58 Serve and enjoy!", "uploadDate": "2020-10-11T18:00:25+00:00", "duration": "PT1M9S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/iqiIP8EfOeI/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/iqiIP8EfOeI?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iqiIP8EfOeI", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4", "4 servings (2 cups each)"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT40M", "totalTime": "PT50M", "recipeIngredient": ["1  yellow onion ($0.70)", "1 lb. broccoli ($1.97*)", "2  carrots ($0.23)", "4 Tbsp butter ($0.40)", "4 Tbsp all-purpose flour ($0.04)", "2 cups chicken broth ($0.26**)", "2 cups whole milk ($0.36)", "\u00bd tsp smoked paprika ($0.05)", "\u00bc tsp garlic powder ($0.02)", "\u00bc tsp black pepper (freshly cracked, $0.02)", "\u215b tsp cayenne pepper ($0.02)", "6 oz. sharp cheddar cheese (shredded, $1.27)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Gather all of your ingredients.", "name": "Ingredients", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/easy-broccoli-cheddar-soup/#wprm-recipe-51821-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Dice the onion and chop the broccoli into very small pieces. This &quot;dump and go&quot; dinner will become a family favorite!", "datePublished": "2025-04-20T08:30:00+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/white-chicken-chili-bowl.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/white-chicken-chili-bowl-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/white-chicken-chili-bowl-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/white-chicken-chili-bowl-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Slow Cooker White Chicken Chili", "description": "This easy and flavorful Slow Cooker White Chicken Chili is an autumn favorite. High protein, high fiber, and high in flavor. FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/2015/01/slow-cooker-white-chicken-chili/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n1 yellow onion \n2 cloves garlic \n1 jalape\u00f1o (optional) \n1 boneless skinless chicken breast (about 3/4 lb.) \n16 oz jar salsa verde \n2 15 oz. cans Essential Everyday\u2122 cannellini beans \n1 15 oz. can Essential Everyday\u2122 pinto beans \n1 Tbsp ground cumin \n1 tsp dried oregano \n\u00bc tsp cayenne pepper \n\u00bc tsp freshly ground black pepper \n2 cups Essential Everyday\u2122 chicken broth \n4 oz Essential Everyday\u2122 Monterrey Jack cheese shredded \n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Dice the onion and mince the garlic. Slice the jalape\u0144o lengthwise, scrape out the seeds with a spoon, then dice. Place the onion, garlic, jalape\u00f1o, and chicken breast in the bottom of a slow cooker.\n2. Drain and rinse the cannellini beans and pinto beans, then add them to the slow cooker, along with the salsa, cumin, oregano, cayenne, and freshly ground black pepper.\n3. Pour two cups of chicken broth over the contents in the cooker and then give everything a brief stir. 4. Place the lid on the slow cooker and cook on high for four hours.\n5. After four hours, the chicken should be tender and easily shreddable (if not, replace the lid and cook for one more hour). Carefully remove the chicken breast from the slow cooker and use two forks to shred the meat. Return the meat to the slow cooker. Stir the chili, slightly mashing the beans with the back of the spoon as you stir.\n6. Serve the chili hot topped with shredded Monterrey Jack cheese. Other optional toppings include fresh cilantro, diced avocado, freshly squeeze lime, or tortilla chips.\n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2017-08-28T17:10:37+00:00", "duration": "PT1M", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/wXTsv0gpFqA/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/wXTsv0gpFqA?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wXTsv0gpFqA", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["6", "6 1.5 cups each"], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT240M", "totalTime": "PT255M", "recipeIngredient": ["1  yellow onion, small dice (heaping 1 cup, 225g) ($0.76)", "2 cloves garlic, minced ($0.12)", "1  jalape\u00f1o, small dice (optional)* ($0.33)", "1  boneless skinless chicken breast (about 3/4 lb.)** ($2.00)", "2  15oz. cans cannellini beans, drained and rinsed ($1.88)", "1 15oz. can pinto beans, drained and rinsed ($0.94)", "1 Tbsp ground cumin ($0.30)", "1 tsp dried oregano ($0.10)", "\u00bc tsp cayenne pepper* ($0.02)", "\u00bc tsp freshly ground black pepper ($0.02)", "1 16oz. jar salsa verde ($2.92)", "2 cups chicken broth (16 oz.) This is my super easy and delish version, but I\u2019ve got lots of ideas for variations in the blog post, too! FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47\n\nGet recipe FAQs, substitutions, and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/easy-egg-salad/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n4 large eggs ($0.93)\n3 Tbsp mayonnaise ($0.22)\n1 Tbsp dill relish ($0.08)\n1 tsp Dijon mustard ($0.06)\n1/4 tsp lemon juice ($0.01)\n1/8 tsp salt ($0.02)\n1/8 tsp pepper ($0.01)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Add the eggs to a sauce pot and cover with water. Place a lid on the pot and turn the heat on to high. Bring the water up to a full boil. Once it reaches a boil, turn the heat off and let the eggs sit in the hot water (lid on) for 12 minutes.\n2. After 12 minutes in the hot water, transfer the eggs to an ice bath or run under cold water until cool. Peel the eggs then chop them into \u00bd-inch pieces.\n3. Add the chopped egg to a bowl along with the mayonnaise, Dijon, relish lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine, mashing some of the egg yolks into the dressing as you stir.\n4. Taste the egg salad and adjust the ingredients to your liking. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to eat.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here. https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:05 Add water to the pot with eggs\n0:09 Cover pot with lid\n0:11 Bring to a boil\n0:15 Chop hardboiled eggs\n0:18 Add seasoning ingredients\n0:24 Mix all together\n0:32 Add lettuce to toasted bread\n0:34 Add egg salad to toasted bread\n0:37 Top with toasted bread\nServe and enjoy!", "uploadDate": "2022-03-20T15:00:11+00:00", "duration": "PT47S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/jywVpiUkOfY/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/jywVpiUkOfY?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jywVpiUkOfY", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["2", "2 about \u00be cup each"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT25M", "recipeIngredient": ["4 large eggs* ($2.68)", "3 Tbsp mayonnaise ($0.15)", "1 Tbsp dill relish** ($0.08)", "1 tsp Dijon mustard ($0.02)", "1/4 tsp lemon juice ($0.01)", "1/8 tsp salt ($0.02)", "1/8 tsp freshly cracked black pepper ($0.02)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the eggs to a saucepot and cover with water. If you don\u2019t have dill relish you can chip up pickles", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Missa"}, "datePublished": "2025-06-22"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Beth this was AMAZING! Easily customizable and doubled. Even though I didn't chill in fridge, which would've been preferred, it was a fantastic, easy dinner with toast! This recipe totally hit the spot and I will be saving it for years, maybe implementing some chopped celery. \r\nThank you!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Chloe"}, "datePublished": "2025-04-10"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Your friend's way is what I do--the shells peel perfectly for any size egg. I've tried multiple instructions, often with dreadful results, and after frustration and even tears, this is the only way I recommend boiling eggs. I read somewhere that the shock of hitting the boiling water frees the membrane from the shell, and it appears to be the case. Gentle is key. I put an egg in a large spoon or small strainer and gently lower it into the hard boiling water. I turn down the heat after it returns to boil as a continued hard boil may crack the eggs.\r\n\r\nMy go-to egg salad recipe is dryer than this--1/2 T mayo and 1/2 tsp dijon mustard per egg. I also like using capers and caper juice, but dill pickle and juice is often what's in my fridge and is delicious, too. Olives, either green or kalamata (although not the kalamata juice as it will discolor the salad), are another nice variation. One reason to continue using full fat mayo is the fact that vitamin A is fat soluble--use fat free mayo or yogurt and you won't capture its benefits.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "janmaus"}, "datePublished": "2025-04-07"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "4"}, "reviewBody": "I made it a bit different..no relish, but used a bit of dill pickle juice instead lemon juice and added dried dill for flavor! You&#39;ll end up using between 2.5 to 3 cups flour total. The dough should be smooth and very soft but not sticky. FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47\n\nGet recipe FAQs, serving suggestions, and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/chicken-stew/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n1 yellow onion ($0.28)\n3 ribs celery ($0.64)\n4 cloves garlic ($0.32)\n1/2 lb. carrots ($0.32)\n1.75 lbs. boneless, skinless chicken thighs ($6.52)\n4 Tbsp all-purpose flour, divided ($0.02)\n2 Tbsp butter ($0.18)\n1 Tbsp olive oil ($0.16)\n1.5 lbs. baby potatoes ($2.89)\n1 tsp dried parsley ($0.10)\n1/2 tsp dried thyme ($0.05)\n1/2 tsp dried rosemary ($0.05)\n1/2 tsp dried sage ($0.05)\n1/4 tsp freshly cracked black pepper ($0.02)\n2 cups chicken broth ($0.26)\n2 cups vegetable broth ($0.26)\n1 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley (optional) ($0.10)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Dice the onion and celery, mince the garlic, slice the carrots, and cut the baby potatoes in half before you begin.\n2. Cut the chicken thighs into 1-inch pieces. Sprinkle 2 Tbsp of the flour over the chicken and toss until the chicken is evenly coated.\n3. Add the butter and olive oil to a large pot. Heat the butter and oil over medium until they are hot and sizzling.\n4. Add the flour-coated chicken to the pot with the butter and oil and allow the chicken to brown on all sides (avoid stirring until browned on the bottom). When the chicken is browned and there is a nice brown layer of flour on the bottom of the pot, remove the chicken to a clean bowl with a slotted spoon. The chicken does not need to be cooked through at this point, just browned on the outside.\n5. Add the onion, celery, garlic, and carrots to the pot and continue to saut\u00e9 until the onions are soft. Use the moisture released by the vegetables to dissolve and scrape the browned bits off the bottom of the pot.\n6. Once the vegetables are slightly softened, add the remaining 2 Tbsp flour to the pot and continue to saut\u00e9 over medium for about two minutes more. The flour will begin to coat the bottom of the pot again.\n7. Return the browned chicken to the pot. Also add the potatoes, parsley, thyme, rosemary, sage, pepper, chicken broth, and vegetable broth. Stir to combine and dissolve any flour off the bottom of the pot.\n8. Place a lid on the pot and allow it to come up to a boil. Once it reaches a boil, remove the lid and turn the heat down to medium-low. Allow the stew to simmer over medium-low, without a lid and stirring occasionally, for about 30 minutes or until the potatoes are tender and the broth has thickened.\n9. Taste the stew and add salt if needed (I did not add any, but it will depend on the salt content of the broth you used). Add a tablespoon of fresh chopped parsley if desired, and serve hot.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:08 Coat chicken in flour\n0:12 Brown chicken thighs\n0:19 Remove Chicken\n0:22 Saut\u00e9 vegetables\n0:30 Add more flour\n0:33 Return chicken\n0:35 Add potatoes and seasonings\n0:42 Add broth\n0:45 Simmer\n0:50 Add fresh parsley\n0:52 Serve and Enjoy", "uploadDate": "2022-01-02T15:41:54+00:00", "duration": "PT1M1S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/WctiyrP3sSw/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/WctiyrP3sSw?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WctiyrP3sSw", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["6", "6 1.5 cups each"], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT45M", "totalTime": "PT60M", Perfect for busy weeknights!&nbsp;", "datePublished": "2018-10-21T17:07:41+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/One-Pot-Creamy-Cajun-Chicken-Pasta-pan.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/One-Pot-Creamy-Cajun-Chicken-Pasta-pan-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/One-Pot-Creamy-Cajun-Chicken-Pasta-pan-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/One-Pot-Creamy-Cajun-Chicken-Pasta-pan-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "One Pot Creamy Cajun Chicken Pasta", "description": "Spicy, creamy, and filling, all with only one pot to wash! Total win. You'll want this one in your weekly rotation. FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/one-pot-creamy-cajun-chicken-pasta/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n\nCAJUN SEASONING\n2 tsp smoked paprika \n1 tsp oregano\n1 tsp thyme\n1/2 tsp garlic powder\n1/2 tsp onion powder \n1/4 tsp cayenne pepper \n1/4 tsp black pepper \n1/4 tsp salt\n\nCHICKEN PASTA\n1 Tbsp olive oil \n1 Tbsp butter \n1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breast \n1 yellow onion, diced \n1/2 lb. penne pasta \n15 oz. fire roasted diced tomatoes \n2 cups chicken broth \n2 oz. cream cheese\n3 green onions, sliced \n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Combine the ingredients for the Cajun seasoning in a small bowl. Cut the chicken into 1/2 to 3/4-inch cubes. Place the cubed chicken in a bowl, pour the Cajun seasoning over top, and stir to coat the chicken in spices.\n2. Add the olive oil and butter to a large deep skillet. Heat the oil and butter over medium-high until the skillet is very hot and the butter is melted and foamy. Add the seasoned chicken to the skillet and cook for a couple minutes on each side, or just until the outside gets some color. The chicken does not need to be cooked through at this point.\n3. Add the diced yellow onion to the skillet and continue to saut\u00e9 for about 2 minutes more, or just until the onion begins to soften. Allow the moisture from the onion to dissolve any browned bits from the bottom of the skillet.\n4. Next, add the pasta, fire roasted diced tomatoes (with the juices), and chicken broth to the skillet. 5. Stir just until everything is evenly combined, then place a lid on top and allow the broth to come up to a boil.\n6. Once boiling, turn the heat down to medium-low and let the pasta simmer for about ten minutes, stirring every couple of minutes, until the pasta is tender and the liquid is thick and saucy.\n7. Add the cream cheese to the skillet in chunks, then stir until it has melted into the sauce. Top the pasta with sliced green onions and serve.\n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2018-12-30T00:42:54+00:00", "duration": "PT1M1S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/qV0F5FiXUXw/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/qV0F5FiXUXw?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qV0F5FiXUXw", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT30M", "recipeIngredient": ["2  tsp smoked paprika ($0.20)", "1 tsp oregano ($0.10)", "1 tsp  thyme ($0.10)", "1/2 tsp garlic powder ($0.05)", "1/2 tsp onion powder ($0.05)", "1/4 tsp cayenne pepper ($0.03)", "1/4 tsp black pepper ($0.02)", "1/4 tsp salt ($0.02)", "1 Tbsp olive oil ($0.16)", "1 Tbsp butter ($0.13)", "1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breast ($5.47)", "1  yellow onion, diced ($0.32)", "1/2 lb. penne pasta (uncooked) ($0.75)", "15 oz. fire roasted diced tomatoes ($1.00)", "2 cups chicken broth ($0.26)", "2 oz. cream cheese ($0.50)", "3  green onions, sliced ($0.25)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Combine the ingredients for the Cajun seasoning in a small bowl. It uses pantry staples and takes just a few minutes to prepare, so no planning ahead needed! FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/2012/06/the-one-chocolate-mug-cake/\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE:  https://www.budgetbytes.com/chicken-l...\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n 2 Tbsp all-purpose flour \n1 Tbsp unsweetened cocoa powder\n2 tsp sugar\n1/4 tsp baking powder \na pinch salt \n1 Tbsp cooking oil \n2 Tbsp milk \n1 Tbsp peanut butter \n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. In your mug, stir together the dry ingredients (flour, cocoa powder, sugar, baking powder, and a pinch of salt). Make sure there are no clumps.\n2. Stir in the vegetable oil and milk until the mixture is smooth. Drop a tablespoon of peanut butter into the center and push it down into the batter.\n3. Microwave on high for one minute and then enjoy!\n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2017-06-11T22:48:57+00:00", "duration": "PT54S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/_cntBl3DZT4/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/_cntBl3DZT4?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_cntBl3DZT4", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["1"], "prepTime": "PT3M", "cookTime": "PT1M", "totalTime": "PT4M", "recipeIngredient": ["2 Tbsp all-purpose flour  ($0.02)", "1 Tbsp unsweetened cocoa powder  ($0.03)", "2 tsp sugar ($0.04*)", "1/4 tsp baking powder  ($0.02)", "a pinch salt  ($0.01)", "1 Tbsp cooking oil  ($0.04)", "2 Tbsp milk  ($0.04)", "1 Tbsp peanut butter  ($0.14)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In your mug, stir together the dry ingredients (flour, cocoa powder, sugar, baking powder, and a pinch of salt). Whisk the ingredients together until the corn starch is fully dissolved. Making great food is my passion, my purpose, and my favorite thing to share with others.", "sameAs": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/about/", "https://www.facebook.com/budgetbytes1", "https://x.com/Budget_Bytes"], "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/author/beth/"}, {"@type": "Recipe", "name": "Lentil Stew Recipe", "author": {"@id": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/#/schema/person/de533a4dad507aefcf8ea04e131701f9"}, "description": "A rich and hearty medley of vegetables, lentils, and herbs makes this freezer-friendly Vegan Lentil Stew the perfect cold-weather comfort food.\u00a0", "datePublished": "2018-10-18T11:51:32+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/Vegan-WInter-Lentil-Stew-dip-bread-1200.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/Vegan-WInter-Lentil-Stew-dip-bread-1200-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/Vegan-WInter-Lentil-Stew-dip-bread-1200-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/Vegan-WInter-Lentil-Stew-dip-bread-1200-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Vegan Winter Lentil Stew", "description": "A rich and hearty medley of vegetables, lentils, and herbs makes this freezer-friendly Vegan Winter Lentil Stew the perfect cold-weather comfort food. FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/vegan-winter-lentil-stew/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n 2 Tbsp olive oil \n1 yellow onion \n4 cloves garlic \n4 carrots (about 1/2 lb.) \n4 stalks celery \n2 lbs potatoes \n1 cup brown lentils\n1 tsp dried rosemary \n1/2 tsp dried thyme\n2 Tbsp Dijon mustard \n1.5 Tbsp soy sauce \n1 Tbsp brown sugar\n6 cups vegetable broth \n1 cup frozen peas\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Dice the onion and mince the garlic. Add the olive oil, onion, and garlic to a large soup pot and begin to saut\u00e9 over medium heat.\n2. While the onion and garlic are saut\u00e9ing, dice the celery, then add it to the pot and continue to saut\u00e9. 3. As the celery, onion, and garlic are saut\u00e9ing, peel and chop the carrots into half rounds. Add the carrots to the pot and continue to saut\u00e9.\n4. As the onion, garlic, celery, and carrots are saut\u00e9ing, peel and cube the potatoes into 3/4 to 1-inch pieces. Add the cubed potatoes to the pot along with the lentils, rosemary, thyme, Dijon, soy sauce, brown sugar, and vegetable broth.\n5. Briefly stir the ingredients to combine, then place a lid on the pot, turn the heat up to high, and bring the stew up to a boil. Once it reaches a boil, turn the heat down to low and let it simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.\n6. Toward the end of the simmer time, when the potatoes are very soft, begin to mash the potatoes a bit as you stir. This will help thicken the stew.\n7. Finally, after 30 minutes, stir in the frozen peas and allow them to heat through. Taste the stew and add salt if needed (this will depend on the salt content of your broth, I did not add any extra). Serve hot and enjoy!\n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2019-01-06T19:19:18+00:00", "duration": "PT56S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/ll4U62_i6IY/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/ll4U62_i6IY?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ll4U62_i6IY", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["8", "8 1.5 cups each"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT50M", "totalTime": "PT60M", "recipeIngredient": ["2 Tbsp  olive oil ($0.44)", "1  yellow onion ($0.70)", "4 cloves garlic ($0.16)", "4  carrots (about 1/2 lb.) I take the meat off the carcass to make the broth.  Then on day 2 ( so after at least 12 hours of cooking the broth) I took all the bits out, then added the diced chicken and veg to the broth and let it slow cook for another 12 hours or so.  Turned out pretty good.\r\n\r\nI also experimented with adding uncooked pasta noodles to the cold soup portions before putting them in the freezer (\u2018cuz a lot of this is take to work portions). When I thawed and reheated the soup, the noodles had a bit of chew but were certainly soft enough for soup.\r\n\r\nCaveat: I use gluten-free pasta which is a bit more delicate than your garden variety wheat based pasta, so not sure if this would work as well with a wheat pasta.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Lise"}, "datePublished": "2025-12-01"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "3"}, "reviewBody": "Definitely needs bouillon. Cover and let the jars sit at room temperature for 24 hours to set. Honestly with strawberries, you don't need pectin depending on how \"jammy\" you want it to be. I've found the jam sets pretty well, especially after freezing. If you are using it for regular use like toast and sandwiches, you don't need to go out of your way. Perfect for potlucks!", "datePublished": "2019-06-29T16:53:30+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/Add-Parmesan-Balsamic-Vinaigrette-to-Tomato-Mozzarella-Pasta-Salad.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/Add-Parmesan-Balsamic-Vinaigrette-to-Tomato-Mozzarella-Pasta-Salad-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/Add-Parmesan-Balsamic-Vinaigrette-to-Tomato-Mozzarella-Pasta-Salad-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/Add-Parmesan-Balsamic-Vinaigrette-to-Tomato-Mozzarella-Pasta-Salad-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Tomato and Mozzarella Pasta Salad", "description": "This Tomato Mozzarella Pasta Salad with homemade Parmesan Balsamic Vinaigrette is the perfect light and fresh summer meal. Perfect for potlucks! FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/tomato-mozzarella-pasta-salad/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n8 oz. bowtie pasta\nsalt for pasta water\n3 cups fresh spinach\n1 pint grape tomatoes\n8 oz. mozzarella* \n\nPARMESAN BALSAMIC VINAIGRETTE\n1/3 cup olive oil\n3 Tbsp balsamic vinegar\n2 Tbsp mayonnaise\n2 Tbsp grated Parmesan\n1/2 Tbsp Dijon mustard\n1 clove garlic, minced\n1/2 tsp dried basil\n1/4 tsp salt\nfreshly cracked pepper\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Fill a pot with water and add two large pinches of salt. Cover the pot and bring it to a boil over high heat. Once boiling, add the pasta and continue to boil until the pasta is tender. Drain the pasta in a colander, give it a brief rinse with cool water, and let it drain well while you prepare the rest of the salad.\n2. While waiting for the pasta to cook, prepare the rest of the salad. Start with the Parmesan Balsamic Vinaigrette. Combine all the dressing ingredients in a jar or blender. Either blend until combined or shake your jar until the ingredients are well combined. Set the dressing aside until needed.\n3. Roughly chop the spinach and slice the grape tomatoes in half. Dice the mozzarella into 1/2-inch cubes.\n4. Add the spinach, tomatoes, and mozzarella to a large bowl. Once the pasta is well drained and mostly cool, add it to the bowl with the mozzarella and vegetables. Make sure the pasta is no longer hot, so it doesn't wilt the spinach or melt the cheese.\n5. Toss the ingredients to combine. If serving the salad later, store it like this without dressing. If serving immediately, add half of the dressing and toss to coat. Add more dressing as desired.\n\nNOTES\n*Fresh mozzarella is best, but block or stick mozzarella can be used in its place. Whole milk mozzarella (not part-skim), if possible.\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2020-03-07T19:08:24+00:00", "duration": "PT1M1S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/UoM0MmkUHMc/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/UoM0MmkUHMc?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UoM0MmkUHMc", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["6", "6 about 1.5 cups each"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT25M", "recipeIngredient": ["8 oz. bowtie pasta ($0.67)", "salt for pasta water ($0.02)", "3 cups fresh spinach ($1.20)", "1 pint grape tomatoes ($2.50)", "8 oz. mozzarella* ($2.60)", "1/3 cup olive oil ($0.55)", "3 Tbsp balsamic vinegar ($0.41)", "2 Tbsp  mayonnaise ($0.17)", "2 Tbsp grated Parmesan ($0.22)", "1/2 Tbsp  Dijon mustard ($0.09)", "1 clove garlic, minced ($0.08)", "1/2 tsp dried basil ($0.05)", "1/4 tsp salt ($0.01)", "freshly cracked pepper ($0.02)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Fill a pot with water and add two large pinches of salt. Once the pasta is well drained and mostly cool, add it to the bowl with the mozzarella and vegetables. Make sure the pasta is no longer hot, so it doesn&#x27;t wilt the spinach or melt the cheese.", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/tomato-mozzarella-pasta-salad/#wprm-recipe-44565-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Toss the ingredients to combine. If serving the salad later, store it like this without dressing. If serving immediately, add half of the dressing and toss to coat. I tried this recipe using half of the brown sugar in the recipe, 2 T, which was enough to create lovely browning on the chops. I made my own apple butter two weeks ago using Stevia instead of sugar, plus 3 T of blackstrap molasses to provide color and depth of flavor. Since sugar is also a preservative, this version of Apple Butter needs to be refrigerated and will only keep weeks instead of years. It was not planned for this recipe, but was fortuitous. So my alterations to this recipe are reduced sugar, not sugar free--but the chops were delicious and I plan to make it several more times this fall.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "janmaus"}, She prefers the kidney beans though!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "ACK"}, "datePublished": "2025-11-16"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "For certain, follow the link to Beth's homemade taco seasoning! It's significantly better than anything your supermarket has. I prefer it largely because the commercial brands are really loaded with salt. I skip the cayenne, but like to add a dab of powdered chipotle instead. Also, I used pinto beans--they never get mentioned here. My personal favorites, they are deliciously creamy, with a milder flavor than kidney beans--they are the beans used for canned refries. I also have a trick for making my quesadillas. I brush one side with a bit of oil or butter, then lay it fat side down flat on the hot skillet, put down the shredded cheese first--as it melts, it acts like glue to hold the filling together. Then put on the rest of the ingredients across the whole tortilla. Watch carefully not to burn, and when nice and toasty, fold it. Make as many as you need for your meal--that's 2 for my small family, 1 for my sister who lives alone--and refrigerate the left over filling for another batch later.", "author": {"@type": "Person", Because sweet potatoes can vary in moisture content, you may need to add extra flour or milk to the dough to get the right consistency. The biscuit dough should be slightly sticky, but not so wet that it is glossy, and no dry flour should remain on the bottom of the bowl. If the dough is too dry (not forming a single ball of dough) add a couple tablespoons of milk. Clean and cut all vegetables.", "name": "Prep", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/vegetable-egg-rolls/#wprm-recipe-32950-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a very large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat and saut\u00e9 the green onion, garlic, and ginger until slightly softened (1-2 minutes). Add the mushrooms and continue to saut\u00e9 until softened (about 5 minutes). Add the carrot and saut\u00e9 for one more minute, then add the cabbage. Continue to cook and stir until the cabbage has reduced in volume by half (increase the heat to medium-high if necessary), about 10 minutes.", "name": "Saute", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/vegetable-egg-rolls/#wprm-recipe-32950-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Dissolve the cornstarch in the soy sauce. Turn the heat off.", "name": "Combine", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/vegetable-egg-rolls/#wprm-recipe-32950-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Give the mixture a taste and adjust the soy sauce and sesame oil to your liking. Place one wrapper at a time on a clean surface and place about 1/4 cup of the cabbage mixture just off-center, close to one of the corners of the square. Roll the corner up and over the filling, fold each side in, and then roll the rest of the way up. FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/goulash/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n 1 Tbsp olive oil \n1 medium onion \n4 cloves garlic \n2 bell peppers \n1 lb ground beef \n1/2 cup red wine*\n1 28oz. can diced tomatoes \n1 15oz. can tomato sauce \n2 Tbsp soy sauce\n2 whole bay leaves (optional) \n1/2 tsp oregano \n1/2 tsp basil \n1/4 tsp red pepper flakes \n1/2 cup water\n2 cups elbow macaroni (about 1/2 lb.) \nsalt to taste\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Dice the onion and mince the garlic. Saut\u00e9 both in a large soup pot with the olive oil over medium heat until the onions are translucent. While the onion and garlic are saut\u00e9ing, dice the bell peppers, then add them to the pot and continue to saut\u00e9 for about two minutes more.\n2. Add the ground beef to the pot with the vegetables and continue to saut\u00e9 over medium until the beef is cooked through. Add the red wine to the pot and stir to dissolve any browned bits off the bottom of the pot.\n3. Add the diced tomatoes (with juices), tomato sauce, soy sauce, bay leaves, oregano, basil, crushed red pepper, and water to the pot. Stir to combine, place a lid on the pot, and allow it to come up to a boil. Once boiling, turn it down to low, and let the sauce simmer for 30 minutes with the lid on, stirring occasionally.\n4. After the sauce has simmered for 30 minutes, add the macaroni and stir to combine. Continue to let the macaroni simmer in the sauce, with the lid on, stirring occasionally, until the pasta is tender (about 10-12 minutes).\n5. Once the pasta is tender, taste the goulash and add salt to taste. Remove the bay leaves, then serve.\n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2019-02-16T22:37:07+00:00", "duration": "PT1M8S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/Gng9zW8mv1g/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/Gng9zW8mv1g?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gng9zW8mv1g", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["6", "6 About 1.5 cups each"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT60M", "totalTime": "PT70M", "recipeIngredient": ["1 Tbsp olive oil ($0.22)", "1  yellow onion  ($0.70)", "4 cloves garlic  ($0.16)", "2  bell peppers  ($1.72)", "1 lb ground beef (see notes, $4.98)", "1/2 cup red wine (see notes, $0.72)", "1 28oz. can diced tomatoes  ($1.63)", "1 15oz. can tomato sauce  ($1.06)", "2 Tbsp soy sauce  ($0.05)", "2  whole bay leaves (optional, $0.30)", "1/2 tsp dried oregano  ($0.05)", "1/2 tsp dried basil  ($0.05)", "1/4 tsp crushed red pepper  ($0.02)", "1/2 cup water ($0.00)", "2 cups elbow macaroni (about 1/2 lb. see notes, $0.59)", "salt to taste ($0.05)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Dice the onion and mince the garlic. These Pizza Roll Ups are the perfect last minute appetizer or indulgent snack on busy days!&nbsp;", "datePublished": "2017-12-30T15:40:30+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Pizza-Roll-Ups-above-1.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Pizza-Roll-Ups-above-1-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Pizza-Roll-Ups-above-1-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Pizza-Roll-Ups-above-1-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Pizza Roll Ups", "description": "Forget frozen pizza rolls! These Pizza Roll Ups are the perfect last minute appetizer or indulgent snack on busy days!  FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47\n\nGet recipe FAQs and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/pizza-roll-ups/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n8 small flour tortillas* ($1.03)\n40 slices pepperoni ($1.32)\n4 mozzarella cheese sticks ($0.83)\noil, as needed ($0.05)\n1/2 cup pizza sauce (for dipping) ($0.48)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Preheat the oven to 400\u00baF. Lightly spritz a baking sheet with spray oil or brush a thin layer of your favorite cooking oil onto the baking sheet.\n2. Stack about 4 tortillas at a time on a plate and cover with a damp paper towel. Microwave for 20-30 seconds, or until they are steamy and pliable. Microwave the second batch when you're ready to roll more.\n3. Slice each of the mozzarella sticks in half, lengthwise. Place about 5 pepperoni on each tortilla in the bottom 1/3 o the circle, then place the halved mozzarella stick on top. Fold the sides of the tortilla in to cover the ends, then roll them up tight light a burrito.\n4. Place the tightly rolled Pizza Roll Ups on the baking sheet, seam side down. Leave them slightly apart from one another to allow hot air to surround the rolls. Either spritz the top with spray oil, or brush a thin layer of oil on top of the roll ups.\n5. Bake the Pizza Roll Ups for 12-15 minutes, or until they're lightly browned and the cheese is just beginning to ooze. Because every oven is different, begin checking on the Pizza Roll Ups at about 10 minutes, then check ever two minutes or so until they're done.\n6. Serve immediately, with pizza sauce for dipping.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:10 Slice cheese sticks in half\n0:24 Fill and roll tortillas\n0:38 Brush with oil\n0:43 Bake\n0:45 Serve and enjoy", "uploadDate": "2022-02-27T21:16:09+00:00", "duration": "PT59S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/arc3bxld0JM/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/arc3bxld0JM?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=arc3bxld0JM", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4", "4 2 rolls each"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT25M", "recipeIngredient": ["8  small flour tortillas* ($1.03)", "40 slices pepperoni ($1.32)", "4  mozzarella cheese sticks ($0.83)", "oil, as needed ($0.05)", "1/2 cup pizza sauce (for dipping) ($0.48)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 400\u00baF. Ratatouille, which I discovered as a new bride with Julia Child's 1st cookbook in hand, is one of my summer treats. This version, a traditional tian, or, gratin, since it includes cheese, is no more fiddly than the traditional version of individually diced and sauteed veggies--and much prettier. I love it! I don't think eggplant freezes well, but since the leftovers disappear within a few days, I never tried to freeze them. When I make the more traditional version, I add some chopped Kalamata olives making a dish that's kind of a hybrid between ratatouille and caponata, but that salty bite is delicious with the blander flavors of eggplant and squashes. I don't like this dish \"crispy,\" but I do want it well cooked. \r\n\r\nAfter reading the comments, I suggest that it may take more or less time in the oven than the recipe indicates! Ovens and individual preferences vary, so if a dish needs more time, don't blame the recipe, but give it more time. FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/2012/07/curry-chicken-salad/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\nDRESSING\n1/4 cup mayonnaise \n1/4 cup plain yogurt \n1 tsp lemon juice \n1/2 tsp honey \n1 tsp curry powder \n1/4 tsp salt \nfreshly cracked pepper \nSALAD\n2.5 cups chopped cooked chicken* \nPinch salt & pepper\n2 stalks celery \n3 whole green onions \n1/2 cup sliced almonds \n1/2 cup raisins\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Make the dressing by stirring together the mayonnaise, yogurt, lemon juice, honey, curry powder, salt, and pepper in a small bowl. Taste the dressing and adjust the curry powder or salt if needed.\n2. Season both sides of the chicken breasts with a light sprinkle of salt and pepper. Cook the chicken breast in either a countertop grill or in a skillet until cooked through. Allow the cooked chicken breast to cool while you prepare the rest of the salad.\n3. Finely dice the celery and slice the green onions. Place the green onion, celery, sliced almonds, and raisins in a large bowl.\n4. Chop the chicken into small cubes and place them in the bowl with the celery, onion, almonds, and raisins. Stir to combine. Pour the dressing over top and stir to coat.\n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2018-04-07T20:45:41+00:00", "duration": "PT1M3S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/pbuTx6aAxyQ/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/pbuTx6aAxyQ?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pbuTx6aAxyQ", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4", "4 servings (1 cup each)"], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT30M", "recipeIngredient": ["\u00bc cup mayonnaise ($0.80)", "\u00bc cup plain yogurt ($0.34)", "1 tsp lemon juice ($0.01)", "\u00bd tsp honey ($0.02)", "1 tsp curry powder (* , $0.10)", "\u00bc tsp salt ($0.02)", "freshly cracked pepper  (to taste , $0.02)", "2.5 cups chopped cooked chicken (** , $6.67)", "pinch salt and pepper ($0.05)", "2  stalks celery ($0.18)", "3  whole green onions ($0.28)", "\u00bd cup sliced almonds ($0.61)", "\u00bd cup raisins ($0.59)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the dressing by stirring together the mayonnaise, yogurt***, lemon juice, honey, curry powder, salt, and pepper in a small bowl. Precooked chicken makes this dinner possible in about 30 minutes. FULL RECIPE BELOW. \n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/southwest-chicken-skillet/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n1 cup uncooked long grain white rice* \n1 cup salsa \n1.5-2 cups precooked shredded chicken** \n15 oz. can black beans \n1 Tbsp chili powder*** \n1 3/4 cups chicken broth**** \n1 cup shredded cheese\n2-3 green onions, sliced\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. In a large skillet, combine the rice, salsa, chicken, black beans (drained), chili powder, and chicken broth. Stir until everything is evenly combined.\n2. Place a tight fitting lid on the skillet, turn the heat on to high, and let the skillet come to a full boil. \n3. As soon as the skillet comes to a boil, turn the heat down to low and let it simmer for 15 minutes. 4. Make sure it is simmering the entire time, turning the heat up slightly if needed (you should be able to hear it simmer quietly).\n5. After 15 minutes, turn off the heat, and let it rest with the lid in place for 5 more minutes. Finally, remove the lid, and fluff the mixture with a fork. All of the liquid should be absorbed and the rice should be tender. Sprinkle 1 cup of shredded cheese over top, replace the lid, and let it sit for a few minutes, or until the cheese is melted. Meanwhile, slice the green onions. Sprinkle the green onions over the melted cheese and serve hot.\n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2019-07-14T20:34:39+00:00", "duration": "PT50S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/EcwhnPcEIK4/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/EcwhnPcEIK4?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EcwhnPcEIK4", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4", "4 to 6"], "prepTime": "PT5M", "cookTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT25M", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup uncooked long grain white rice ($0.33)", "1 cup salsa ($0.65)", "1.5-2 cups shredded chicken (precooked, $3.50)", "1  15oz. can black beans  ($0.49)", "1 Tbsp chili powder ($0.30)", "1 3/4 cups chicken broth ($0.23)", "1 cup shredded cheese  ($1.00)", "2-3  green onions (sliced, $0.26)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large skillet, combine the rice, salsa, chicken, black beans (drained), chili powder, and chicken broth. Divide the brine ingredients evenly between the two bags. Close the bags and gently massage to help dissolve the salt and sugar. Those reduced priced cuts are perfectly good for cooking within 48 hours, and they tend to fly off the shelves. The regular price for ground chuck at most of my local stores is about $7, ground round at $8, and ground sirloin just under $9. Aldi sells beef chuck roast for $7.99 per lb, and says an average chuck roast is about 2.4 lbs. This recipe makes 8 servings, possibly more, so the cost per serving, even given a slightly higher meat price is still very good and definitely well under what a biria taco costs at a taco truck or Mexican restaurant (cheapest price I saw in my area was 3 tacos for $10.99, 1 for 3.99). A more affordable option is pork, and while pork shoulder is often on sale very inexpensively--like about $2 per lb, The cuts are huge. If you have freezer space, you can get a big one and cut it into 2-3 lb sections--or ask the butcher to do it at the store--and use one of them for this recipe. It will be delicious!\r\n\r\nBeef problems exist in part due to drought in ranching areas in the past several years during which herds were reduced, in part by selling heifers into the beef market, due to high feed costs and relatively low beef prices. During the past several years, demand has increased and prices have jumped, but it takes 2-3 years for a heifer to go from birth to delivering her first calf, and about a year and a half for that calf to come to market. Today ranchers breed heifers at younger ages than my father did years ago but it can be risky for the heifer. Gestation is 9-10 months. While ewes produce 2-3 lambs per breeding cycle with 5 month gestation, cows generally have a single calf. Pigs deliver their first litters at about 1 year, and with gestation under 4 months can produce 2 or more per year of 8-12 piglets, or more, that are ready for market at about 6 months of age, meaning Add the remaining cloves of peeled garlic and sliced lemon around the chicken. If you're sensitive to bitter flavors, add the additional lemon slices after baking. FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47\n\nGet recipe FAQs, substitutions, and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/can-eat-cabbage-soup/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n1 yellow onion ($0.32)\n4 cloves garlic ($0.32)\n1 Tbsp olive oil ($0.16)\n4 carrots ($0.57)\n4 ribs celery ($0.50)\n1 green bell pepper ($0.69)\n1 28oz. can diced tomatoes ($1.00)\n1 8oz. can tomato sauce ($0.34)\n1/2 lb. frozen green beans ($0.67)\n1/4 cup chopped parsley ($0.23)\n1/2 Tbsp smoked paprika ($0.15)\n1 tsp dried oregano ($0.10)\n1/2 tsp dried thyme ($0.05)\n1/4 tsp freshly cracked black pepper ($0.02)\n6 cups chopped cabbage (\u00bd head) ($1.14)\n6 cups vegetable broth ($0.78)\n1 tsp salt ($0.05)\n1 Tbsp lemon juice ($0.04)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Dice the onion and mince the garlic. Add the onion, garlic, and olive oil to a large soup pot and saut\u00e9 over medium heat until the onions are soft.\n2. While the onion and garlic are saut\u00e9ing, peel and slice the carrots, chop the celery, and dice the bell pepper. Add the carrot, celery, and bell pepper to the pot. Continue to saut\u00e9 as you measure the rest of the ingredients.\n3. Add the diced tomatoes (with juices), tomato sauce, frozen green beans, chopped parsley, smoked paprika, oregano, thyme, and pepper. Continue to stir and cook while you chop the cabbage.\n5. Chop the cabbage into 1-inch pieces. Add the cabbage to the pot along with the vegetable broth and stir to combine.\n6. Place a lid on the pot, turn the heat up to medium-high, and allow the soup to come to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to medium-low and allow it to continue to simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 40 minutes or until the cabbage is to your desired tenderness.\n7. Once the cabbage is tender, season the soup with salt, starting with \u00bd tsp and adding more to your liking. Finish the soup by adding the lemon juice and stirring to combine. Serve hot with crusty bread for dipping.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here. https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:08 Saut\u00e9 0live oil, yellow onion and garlic\n0:13 Add carrots, celery, and bell pepper\n0:19 Add tomatoes, beans, and seasoning\n0:32 Add cabbage and vegetable broth\n0:35 Stir and simmer\n0:41 Add salt and lemon juice\n0:43 Serve and enjoy!", "uploadDate": "2022-04-24T15:00:25+00:00", It&#039;s the perfect dish for special occasions!Step-by-step photos can be seen below the recipe card.", "datePublished": "2022-01-29T10:20:42+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/Shrimp-Alfredo-Pasta-bowl2.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/Shrimp-Alfredo-Pasta-bowl2-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/Shrimp-Alfredo-Pasta-bowl2-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/Shrimp-Alfredo-Pasta-bowl2-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Shrimp Alfredo Pasta", "description": "Shrimp Alfredo Pasta is quick and easy to prepare, but feels extra special and luxurious. It's the perfect dish for special occasions! FULL RECIPE BELOW \ud83d\udc47 \n\nGet recipe FAQs, substitutions, and a printable version here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/shrimp-alfredo-pasta/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n1/2 lb. medium shrimp, peeled and deveined ($4.99)\n1/2 lb. fettuccine ($0.67)\n2 Tbsp butter, divided ($0.20)\n4 cloves garlic, minced ($0.32)\n1 cup heavy cream ($1.00)\n3/4 cup Parmesan* ($1.08)\n1/8 tsp salt (or to taste) ($0.02)\n1/4 tsp freshly cracked pepper (or to taste) ($0.02)\n1 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley (optional) ($0.10)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. If your shrimp is frozen, thaw and peel before beginning. You can remove the tails or leave the tails on, if you prefer.\n2. Bring a pot of water to a boil for the fettuccine. Once boiling, add the fettuccine and boil until tender (7-10 minutes). Reserve a \u00bd cup of the starchy water before draining the pasta in a colander.\n3. While the fettuccine is boiling, prepare the shrimp and alfredo sauce. Place the peeled shrimp on a cutting board and pat dry with a paper towel. Season the shrimp with a pinch of salt and pepper.\n4. Add 1 tablespoon butter to a large skillet and heat over medium. Once hot, swirl to coat the surface of the skillet with butter. Add the shrimp and cook for 1-2 minutes on each side, or just until opaque and pink (do not overcook the shrimp). Transfer the cooked shrimp to a clean bowl.\n5. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Add 1 tablespoon butter to the skillet along with the minced garlic. Saut\u00e9 the garlic for 1-2 minutes, or just until it is very fragrant but not brown.\n6. Add the heavy cream to the skillet and whisk to dissolve any browned bits off the bottom of the skillet. Allow the cream to come up to a simmer.\n7. Whisk the Parmesan into the hot cream until melted. Season the sauce with salt and pepper.\n8. Add the cooked and drained pasta and cooked shrimp back to the skillet with the sauce (make sure to add any liquid from the bowl of shrimp). Toss everything until coated in sauce. If the sauce becomes too thick or dry, add some of the reserved pasta water to loosen it up.\n9. Taste the pasta and add more salt or pepper if needed. Top with chopped fresh parsley and serve!\n\nNOTES\n*This recipe works with both grated or shredded Parmesan.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here. https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:08 Boil Pasta\n0:14 Pat shrimp dry\n0:16 Season shrimp\n0:18 Melt butter and cook shrimp\n0:25 Remove shrimp and add sauce ingredients\n0:30 Whisk sauce\n0:32 Add Parmesan, salt and pepper \n0:41 Add pasta and shrimp\n0:45 Toss and serve", "uploadDate": "2022-06-12T15:00:49+00:00", "duration": "PT1M2S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/T-piHLjy_cQ/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/T-piHLjy_cQ?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T-piHLjy_cQ", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["4"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT30M", "recipeIngredient": ["\u00bd lb. frozen shrimp (or fresh, medium-sized (36/40, peeled and deveined) $6.71)", "\u00bd lb. fettuccine ($0.59)", "2 Tbsp butter (divided, $0.20)", "4  garlic cloves (minced, $0.16)", "1 cup heavy cream ($1.68)", "\u00be cup Parmesan ($1.08*)", "\u215b tsp salt (or to taste, $0.02)", "\u00bc tsp black pepper (freshly cracked, (or to taste) $0.02)", "1 Tbsp fresh parsley (chopped, (optional) $0.10)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If your shrimp is frozen, thaw and peel before beginning. Toss the cauliflower in the oil and spices until they are fairly evenly coated.", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/spicy-roasted-cauliflower-cheese-sauce/#wprm-recipe-35778-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the seasoned cauliflower to the preheated oven and roast for 30 minutes, stirring once half way through.", "name": "Transfer the seasoned cauliflower to the preheated oven and roast for 30 minutes, stirring once half way through.", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/spicy-roasted-cauliflower-cheese-sauce/#wprm-recipe-35778-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "About half way through the roasting time, begin the cheese sauce. This should only take a couple of minutes.", "name": "About half way through the roasting time, begin the cheese sauce. Add the evaporated milk and butter to a small sauce pot. Heat over medium, while stirring, until the butter has melted and the evaporated milk is hot. This should only take a couple of minutes.", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/spicy-roasted-cauliflower-cheese-sauce/#wprm-recipe-35778-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Turn the heat under the evaporated milk to LOW and begin whisking in the shredded cheddar, one handful at a time, making sure the cheese is fully melted before adding the next handful. Once all the cheese is melted into the evaporated milk the sauce will thicken. If it's still very liquidy, keep the sauce over low heat and whisk constantly until it thickens. Often the cheese appears to be completely melted, but it has not yet totally emulsified. Remove the cheese sauce from the heat until ready to serve.*", "name": "Turn the heat under the evaporated milk to LOW and begin whisking in the shredded cheddar, one handful at a time, making sure the cheese is fully melted before adding the next handful. Once all the cheese is melted into the evaporated milk the sauce will thicken. If it's still very liquidy, keep the sauce over low heat and whisk constantly until it thickens. Often the cheese appears to be completely melted, but it has not yet totally emulsified. Dice the onion, mince the garlic, and grate or mince the ginger (I use a small-holed cheese grater). Saut\u00e9 the onion, garlic, and ginger in the olive oil over medium heat for 2-3 minutes, or until the onions are soft and transparent. While the onions, garlic, and ginger are saut\u00e9ing, peel and slice the carrots.", "name": "Add the olive oil to a large pot. Dice the onion, mince the garlic, and grate or mince the ginger (I use a small-holed cheese grater). Saut\u00e9 the onion, garlic, and ginger in the olive oil over medium heat for 2-3 minutes, or until the onions are soft and transparent. While the onions, garlic, and ginger are saut\u00e9ing, peel and slice the carrots.", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/golden-coconut-lentil-soup/#wprm-recipe-30403-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the turmeric and red pepper to the pot and saut\u00e9 for a minute more. Add the carrots to the pot, saut\u00e9 for a minute more, then add the lentils and water. Place a lid on the pot, bring it up to a boil over high heat, then turn the heat down to low and simmer for 20 minutes.", "name": "Add the turmeric and red pepper to the pot and saut\u00e9 for a minute more. Add the carrots to the pot, saut\u00e9 for a minute more, then add the lentils and water. Place a lid on the pot, bring it up to a boil over high heat, then turn the heat down to low and simmer for 20 minutes.", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/golden-coconut-lentil-soup/#wprm-recipe-30403-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Toast the coconut flakes while the soup simmers. Add the coconut flakes to a dry skillet and place it over medium-low heat. Stir continuously as the flakes heat until they are about 50% golden brown (1-3 minutes). Remove the flakes from the hot skillet immediately to stop the toasting process.", "name": "Toast the coconut flakes while the soup simmers. Add the coconut flakes to a dry skillet and place it over medium-low heat. Stir continuously as the flakes heat until they are about 50% golden brown (1-3 minutes). Remove the flakes from the hot skillet immediately to stop the toasting process.", "url": "https://www.budgetbytes.com/golden-coconut-lentil-soup/#wprm-recipe-30403-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "After 20 minutes the lentils should be soft and broken down. Stir the coconut milk into the soup. Use an immersion blender or carefully blend the warm soup in small batches until about half of the soup is pur\u00e9ed (or all of it if you want it completely smooth). Once blended, begin adding salt, 1/2 tsp at a time, until the soup is properly seasoned. I used 1.5 tsp or 1/2 Tbsp of salt. Also adjust the red pepper flakes, if desired.", "name": "After 20 minutes the lentils should be soft and broken down. Stir the coconut milk into the soup. Use an immersion blender or carefully blend the warm soup in small batches until about half of the soup is pur\u00e9ed (or all of it if you want it completely smooth). Once blended, begin adding salt, 1/2 tsp at a time, until the soup is properly seasoned. I used 1.5 tsp or 1/2 Tbsp of salt. FULL RECIPE BELOW. \n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/honey-mustard-wings/\n\nINGREDIENTS\n\nBAKED CHICKEN WINGS\n2 lbs. chicken wings or drumettes ($6.97)\n1/4 tsp salt ($0.02)\n1/4 tsp pepper ($0.02)\n1/4 tsp garlic powder ($0.02)\n3 Tbsp cornstarch ($0.09)\n\nHONEY MUSTARD SAUCE*\n1/4 cup mayonnaise ($0.40)\n1/2 Tbsp Dijon mustard ($0.05)\n1/2 Tbsp yellow mustard ($0.04)\n1 1/2 Tbsp Honey ($0.18)\n1/2 tsp apple cider vinegar ($0.01)\n1/16 tsp garlic powder ($0.01)\n1/16 tsp paprika ($0.01)\n1/16 tsp salt ($0.01)\n1/8 tsp pepper ($0.01)\n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Preheat the oven to 400\u00baF. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or foil, then place two wire cooling racks over top to elevate the chicken wings.\n2. In a small bowl, stir together the cornstarch, salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Pat the chicken wings dry, then add them to a bowl with the cornstarch mixture, and stir until the chicken wings are coated.\n3. Place the cornstarch coated wings on the prepared baking sheet (on the wire racks). Bake in the oven for 50 minutes, give or take 5 minutes depending on the size of the wings, or until they are light golden brown and the skin is crispy.\n4. While the wings are baking, make the honey mustard sauce. Stir together the mayonnaise, Dijon, yellow mustard, honey, vinegar, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper in a bowl.\n5. When the chicken wings are finished baking, place them in a clean bowl and pour the honey mustard sauce over top. Stir until the wings are coated. Serve immediately.\n\nNOTES\n*This recipe makes enough honey mustard to coat the chicken wings. If you\u2019d like enough honey mustard sauce to have extra for dipping, like in the photos, I suggest doubling the sauce ingredients.\n\nSee how we calculate recipe costs here: https://www.budgetbytes.com/how-to-calculate-recipe-costs/\n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes\n\nTIMESTAMPS\n0:00 Introduction\n0:09 Make seasoned cornstarch\n0:16 Dry chicken wings and coat in cornstarch\n0:21 Bake chicken wings\n0:26 Make honey mustard sauce\n0:41 Toss baked wings in sauce\n0:52 Serve and enjoy!", "uploadDate": "2021-02-06T16:00:11+00:00", "duration": "PT1M1S", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/Um-efK0IlHw/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/Um-efK0IlHw?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Um-efK0IlHw", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["2", "2 5-6 pieces each"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT50M", "totalTime": "PT60M", "recipeIngredient": ["2 lbs. chicken wings or drumettes ($6.97)", "1/4 tsp salt ($0.02)", "1/4 tsp pepper ($0.02)", "1/4 tsp garlic powder ($0.02)", "3 Tbsp cornstarch ($0.09)", "1/4 cup mayonnaise ($0.40)", "1/2 Tbsp Dijon mustard ($0.05)", "1/2 Tbsp yellow mustard ($0.04)", "1 1/2 Tbsp Honey ($0.18)", "1/2 tsp apple cider vinegar ($0.01)", "1/16 tsp garlic powder ($0.01)", "1/16 tsp paprika ($0.01)", "1/16 tsp salt ($0.01)", "1/8 tsp pepper ($0.01)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 400\u00baF. Try the suggested variations to make it your own!&nbsp;", "datePublished": "2019-03-19T12:04:43+00:00", "image": ["https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/Grount-Turkey-Stir-Fry-Meal-Prep.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/Grount-Turkey-Stir-Fry-Meal-Prep-500x500.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/Grount-Turkey-Stir-Fry-Meal-Prep-500x375.jpg", "https://www.budgetbytes.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/Grount-Turkey-Stir-Fry-Meal-Prep-480x270.jpg"], "video": {"name": "Ground Turkey Stir Fry", "description": "This super easy Ground Turkey Stir Fry is a delicious and versatile answer to busy weeknight dinners. Try the suggested variations to make it your own! FULL RECIPE BELOW.\n\nPRINTABLE RECIPE: https://www.budgetbytes.com/ground-turkey-stir-fry/\n\nFull Recipe \ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\ud83d\udc47\n\nINGREDIENTS\n\n STIR FRY SAUCE\n1/4 cup soy sauce \n1/2 Tbsp toasted sesame oil \n1/2 Tbsp brown sugar \n1 pinch red pepper flakes (optional) \n1 Tbsp water \n\nSTIR FRY\n2 bell peppers \n4 green onions\n2 oz. spinach (two large handfuls, or 1/4 of an 8oz. bag) \n2 Tbsp cooking oil of choice\n2 cloves garlic, minced \n19 oz. ground turkey* \n\nFOR SERVING\n1/4 cup chopped peanuts \n2.5 cups cooked brown rice \n\nINSTRUCTIONS\n1. Make the stir fry sauce by stirring together the soy sauce, toasted sesame oil, brown sugar, red pepper, and water until the sugar is dissolved. Set the sauce aside.\n2. Dice the bell peppers and slice the green onions.\n3. Heat the cooking oil in a very large skillet over medium heat. Once hot, add the ground turkey and minced garlic. Stir and cook until the turkey is cooked through and no water is left pooling on the bottom of the skillet (8-10 minutes).\n4. Once the turkey is cooked and the moisture has evaporated, add the bell pepper and green onions to the skillet. Stir and cook for about 2 minutes more, then add the spinach and continue to cook just until it is about half wilted (1-2 minutes).\n5. Pour the stir fry sauce into the skillet. Continue to stir and cook the turkey and vegetables until everything is coated in sauce and the spinach is fully wilted (about 2 minutes more).\n6. Serve about 1 cup of the stir fry mixture with 1/2 cup rice and a sprinkle of chopped peanuts over top. \n\n\nInstagram: budgetbytes\nFacebook: budgetbytes1\nPinterest: budgetbytes\nTwitter: budget_bytes", "uploadDate": "2019-09-05T20:42:11+00:00", "duration": "PT1M", "thumbnailUrl": "https://i.ytimg.com/vi/62GkkUtvJO4/hqdefault.jpg", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/62GkkUtvJO4?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=62GkkUtvJO4", "@type": "VideoObject"}, "recipeYield": ["5", "5 (about 1 cup stir fry, 1/2 cup rice)"], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT25M", "recipeIngredient": ["1/4 cup soy sauce ($0.20)", "1/2 Tbsp toasted sesame oil ($0.13)", "1/2 Tbsp brown sugar ($0.02)", "1 pinch red pepper flakes (optional) ($0.02)", "1 Tbsp  water ($0.00)", "2  bell peppers ($1.72)", "4  green onions ($0.38)", "2 oz. spinach (two large handfuls, or 1/4 of an 8oz. bag) ($0.65)", "2 Tbsp cooking oil of choice ($0.08)", "2 cloves garlic, minced ($0.08)", "19 oz. ground turkey* ($3.78)", "1/4 cup chopped peanuts ($0.31)", "2.5 cups cooked brown rice ($0.68)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the stir fry sauce by stirring together the soy sauce, toasted sesame oil, brown sugar, red pepper, and water until the sugar is dissolved. This step is a great time to practice your knife skills or skip laboring over cutting everything and just chop it up coarsely. This recipe is very forgiving, and it\u2019s fun to have a lot of different shapes that will contribute to the texture once it is fermented later.", "name": "Prep all the vegetables: roughly chop or slice both cabbages, roughly chop the green onion (discarding only the very tip of the root), dice celery, julienne carrots, remaining \u00bd red bell pepper, and remaining \u00bc red onion. You should see a significant amount of liquid brine rising to the top, covering your vegetables whenever you push it down with the spoon (or clean fingers!) Don\u2019t waste the brine; top off the jars as much as you can to cover the veggies.", "name": "With clean hands, spoon your mixture into jars and push it down firmly with the spoon once full.
